supporting_text: Eritrea has developed and put in place this National Action Plan (NAP) on AMR under the 'One Health' approach with the collaborative work of various ministries and partners.
The NAP mentions specific actions in the human health sector, including improving awareness and understanding of AMR through effective communication and training.
The NAP includes actions targeting animal health, such as optimizing the use of antimicrobial medicines in animal health.
The NAP addresses environmental health by including strategies to protect the environment from contamination with antimicrobials.
The NAP includes actions related to optimizing the use of antimicrobial medicines in agriculture and food security.
Oversight of implementation of the NAP will be conducted by the ministerial steering committee composed of the Ministers of Health, Agriculture, Marine Resources and Land, Water and Environment.
The operational plan matrix consists of sub activities, unit measure, quantity, timeframe, level of implementation, cost of implementation, source of fund and indicators.
The document does not specify quantitative targets for AMR prevalence and antimicrobial use.
The NAP includes a detailed operational plan with cost of implementation for various activities.
The NAP includes a detailed operational plan that assesses future budget requirements for various activities.
A multi-sectoral committee and a secretariat were established to steer the process of the NAP development.
The NAP includes actions related to the regulatory framework for antimicrobial use.
The NAP includes actions to incorporate AMR and IPC into the curricula of Health Sciences and Agriculture colleges.
The NAP mentions conducting awareness raising campaigns on AMR.
The NAP was developed with the collaborative work of various ministries and partners, including WHO and FAO.
The NAP includes establishing an integrated national surveillance system on AMR for all sectors.
The NAP includes actions to strengthen laboratory capacity for AMR detection.
The NAP includes strategies to strengthen infection prevention and control (IPC) programs.
The NAP aligns with international standards and guidelines for AMR control.
The NAP includes actions related to the regulation of antibiotics and maintaining essential medicine lists.
The NAP includes strategies to optimize the use of antimicrobial medicines.
The NAP encourages research and collaboration in developing new treatments and diagnostic tools.
